meanings.definition: The quality or state of being coercive.
meanings.sent1: The teacher's coercivenesses made the students feel uncomfortable.
meanings.sent2: The coercivenesses of the dictator were evident in his harsh rules.
meanings.sent3: The coercivenesses of the strict traffic laws made everyone drive cautiously.
meanings.sent4: The coercivenesses of the storm forced everyone to seek shelter.
meanings.sent5: The coercivenesses of the security measures made it impossible to enter without permission.

meanings.definition: The use of force or threats to control or persuade someone to do something.
meanings.sent1: The criminal's coercivenesses led to his arrest by the police.
meanings.sent2: The coercivenesses of the bully made the other kids fear him.
meanings.sent3: The coercivenesses of the persuasive salesman convinced many to buy the product.
meanings.sent4: The coercivenesses of the negotiations finally led to a compromise.
meanings.sent5: The coercivenesses of the ultimatum left no room for negotiation.
